page.title: 08SADBERGE RABY HOUSE.
page.content: {Raby House}is one of the oldest houses in the village dating back to the 1700's.The house has a lounge,living room and dining room.Upstairs there are four bedrooms,a bathroom and a seperate W.C.All the living rooms have a fireplace but the house is centrally heated.The bedrooms are decorated and furnished in the old fashioned style of a hundred years ago.The backyard is most interesting, it has an{earth {closet}with a wooden seat and two holes side by side.It has a well which has been filled in with rubble.Inside the rubbish-bin house,you can see cobble stones that were part of the {Roman road Rynkneild Steet}that ran through the village. This is the only place in the village where any trace of the Roman road remains. By Rachel Smith AGE 11.
